test.name: User able to click add task button

kw.name: Open Android Application
Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://appium.io/docs/en/2.1/cli/args/ | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias | | strict_ssl | No | allows you to send commands to an invalid certificate host like a self-signed one. |
Opens the Android application using Appium with predefined configuration.

kw.name: Verify Add Task Button Visible
Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.
Verifies that the Add Task button is visible on the home page.

kw.name: Click Add Task
Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.
Clicks the Add Task button on the home page.

kw.name: Verify New Task Page Visible
Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.
Verifies that the New Task page is displayed correctly. Checks the page title, task name input field, and Apply button visibility.

kw.name: Close Application
Remove Application
kw.doc: Removes the application that is identified with an application id

kw.name: Close All Applications
kw.doc: Closes all open applications.
Closes the Android application and removes it from the device.

test.doc: Verifies that the user can access the New Task page by clicking the Add Task button.

test.name: Verify add new task

kw.name: Open Android Application
Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://appium.io/docs/en/2.1/cli/args/ | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias | | strict_ssl | No | allows you to send commands to an invalid certificate host like a self-signed one. |
Opens the Android application using Appium with predefined configuration.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Get Date
Get Current Date
kw.doc: Returns current local or UTC time with an optional increment.

kw.name: Add Time To Date
kw.doc: Adds time to date and returns the resulting date.

kw.name: Convert Date
kw.doc: Converts between supported `date formats`.
Returns a formatted date string based on the current date and day offset.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.
Clicks the Add Task button on the home page.

Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.

kw.name: Fill Task Form
Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Clear Text
kw.doc: Clears the text field identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.doc: Types the given `text` into text field identified by `locator`.

kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Scroll To Select Date
Build Locator
Convert To String
kw.doc: Converts the given item to a Unicode string.

kw.name: Replace String
kw.doc: Replaces ``search_for`` in the given ``string`` with ``replace_with``.

Replaces a substring in a given locator with a new value (e.g., placeholders). Arguments: - locator: Original locator string. - search_for: Substring or placeholder to be replaced. - replace_with: Value used to replace the placeholder.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Is Element Visible
Run Keyword And Return Status
Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.
Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.
Checks whether an element becomes visible within the specified timeout.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Swipe Down To Top
kw.doc: Performs a swipe gesture from the lower part of the element to the upper part.
Scrolls through the calendar date list and selects the specified date.

kw.name: Clear Text
kw.doc: Clears the text field identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.doc: Types the given `text` into text field identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.
Fills in the task form with the provided task name. Optionally sets reminder date and time. Submits the task if apply flag is set to True.

kw.name: Verify Remind Information Result
Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.
Verifies that reminder information is displayed after setting a reminder.

kw.name: Apply Task
Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.
Submits the task by clicking the Apply button.

kw.name: Verify Task Name Visible
Format Task Name
Convert To Upper Case
kw.doc: Converts string to upper case.

kw.name: Format String
kw.doc: Formats a ``template`` using the given ``positional`` and ``named`` arguments.
Formats a task name by capitalizing the first letter.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc: Waits until `text` appears on current page.

kw.name: Wait Until Page Does Not Contain
kw.doc: Waits until `text` disappears from current page.
Verifies whether a task name is visible or not visible on the page.

kw.name: Close Application
Remove Application
kw.doc: Removes the application that is identified with an application id

kw.name: Close All Applications
kw.doc: Closes all open applications.
Closes the Android application and removes it from the device.

test.doc: Verifies that a user can add a new task with a reminder date successfully.
